title: Life's a beach
text:
A surf and spa retreat for the weary (isn't that all of us?) 11 Sep 2015 at 11:15 119 viewed 0 comments NEWSPAPER SECTION: GURU | WRITER: MIKA APICHATSAKOL 
Beachfront Penthouse Suite. - + Relaxation doesn’t always mean doing nothing at a nice hotel. Boathouse by Montara, located on Phuket’s Kata beach, provides enough activities and attractions to keep you from spending your entire getaway in your hotel room. The 26-year-old property, which underwent major renovations three years ago, includes the Boathouse Resort, Boathouse Wine & Grill and the Re Ka Ta Beach Club. Boathouse Resort 
For accommod ation, the boutique resort divides its 38 rooms into eight types, from the smallest Superior Rooms to the ultimate Beachfront Penthouse Suite, more than four times the size of the Superior. But you don’t need 136m² of private space to feel like you’re on an important vacation with your companion. The mid-range Deluxe Beachfront, ranging from B5780++ to B8,500++ per night in Sep and Oct, is luxuriously spacious and five seconds away from the beach (four if you’re excited). The only features of the rooms that seemed to lag behind Boathouse’s shining four-star standards were amenities and cleanliness. The floors could have used a quick extra sweep before our arrival. 
Re Ka Ta Spa. 
Quiksilver Surf School at Re Ka Ta Beach Club. Boathouse Wine & Grill 
The tourist’s habit of staying at a hotel and avoiding the hotel’s restaurant — except for the “complimentary” breakfast, that is — doesn’t apply at the Boathouse. Boathouse is known as the area hotel that people go to for food, regardless where they are staying. One of the reasons for the culinary popularity of Boathouse is its wine offerings, which has earned “two glasses”— a silver medal for wines — from Wine Spectator in the nine consecutive years since 2006. 
You can enjoy wine tasting by the beach at the Boathouse Wine & Grill (B750++ for three glasses), daily, from 11am. Extend the experience to a steak dinner at the Wine & Grill and watch the sun go down and jazz music come alive. Sound romantic? Well, then it’s no wonder that one night during my stay a fellow guest popped the question to his girlfriend here. 
Boathouse Wine & Grill. Re Ka Ta Beach Club 
The beach club is going to be your favourite part of Boathouse, especially if two words do it for you —“surf” and “spa”. The Quiksilver Surf School is part of the Re Ka Ta Beach Club, and is enjoyed by kids and adults alike. B1000 will get you a one-on-one lesson with national surf champion Jimmy Smith, plus an hour of free time on the waves. You can also ask the friendly staff to arrange other types of water sports, such as parasailing or jet-skiing, if you can’t get enough action. After an hour battling the sun, sand and sea, trust me, you’ll be needing that hour or so at the Re Ka Ta Spa, followed by teatime at the Re Ka Ta Cafe. 
Re Ka Ta Beach Club. Seasonal Specials 
Until the end of Oct, Boathouse is offering the “Phuket Epic Adventure Package”, designed in collaboration with Lonely Planet and Quiksilver. We must admit, it is indeed epic. The package adds one thrilling local activity to a two-person, three-night stay for a discounted price. Your adventure options include learning to surf on Kata’s shoreline, zip-lining through Phuket’s tropical rainforests at high speeds and altitudes, and exploring the wonders of Phang Nga’s sea caves by canoe. The package starts at B4,675++ per night for a Superior Room. You also get 20 per cent off food and non-alcoholic beverages at the hotel. 
If you’re sold on the adventure package or the idea of a spa retreat — or if you think you’ll be soiled with sand from surfing day in and out — just remember to pack your own sandals and toiletries (or get them from the Family Mart across the street). Then nothing will bother you from a relaxing yet activity-filled getaway at the Boathouse on Kata Beach. 
V Boathouse by Montara, 182 Koktanode Road, Kata Beach, Phuket. GET WELL, AWAY 
Wellness Workshop, JW Marriott Phuket Resort & Spa, Sep 17 – 20 
Getting away doesn’t have to entail weight gain. Join a wellness workshop hosted by internationally renowned yoga instructor Kim White and traditional Chinese medicine specialist Ken Rosen to kickstart a healthier lifestyle. The three-day programme includes holistic and natural approaches to wellness, deeper understanding of the relationship between mind and body, yoga basics and life tips. The package includes a stay in a Deluxe Sala Garden View room, three meals per day, seven classes with Kim White, sessions on nutrition and meditation, and daily workshops. It is only open to 10-15 people. 
V JW Marriott Phuket Resort & Spa, 231 Moo 3, Mai Khao, Thalang, Phuket. C 076-338-000.P B30,000 per person or B25,000 per person for double occupancy. WHERE ON EARTH? 
Geographical Indication Market, Klong Phadung Krung Kasem Canal, Through Sep 27 
The Ministry of Commerce is organising a special market, selling special products from geographical regions across Thailand. Coffee beans from Chiang Rai’s Doi Tung and grilled pork from Trang are among the offerings. The term “GI” is used with products of specific geographical origin (a town, a country, etc), which have qualities unique location — or are made according to traditional methods. The first round of the market, which runs until Sep 13, will see products hailing Thailand’s north and northeastern regions. The second round will see products from the central, east and southern parts of Thailand. The market will take place around Khlong Phadung Krung Kasem canal, next to Government House. 
V 10am-7pm. Khlong Phadung Krung Kasem, Luk Luang Road. PUTTS IN STORE 
Hua Hin Golf Festival Package, Amari Hua Hin, Through Sep 30 
To coincide with Golf Festival Hua Hin/Cha-am 2015, Amari Hua Hin offers a getaway for golf enthusiasts. The package includes accommodations for four days, daily breakfast, a 15 per cent discount on F&B, a 30 per cent discount on spa treatments, Wi-Fi access and, most importantly, three rounds of golf at some of the most popular courses in Hua. Among them are Banyan Golf Club, Sea Pines Golf Course and Black Mountain Golf Resort. Guests must pay for caddy fees, tips, golf cart rental and transfer to golf course. 
V Amari Hua Hin, 117/74, Takiab Road, Nong Kae, Hua Hin, Prachuap Khiri Khan.C 032-616-600. VEGETARIAN VACAY 
Hot Deal, Amari Phuket, Oct 13 – 21 
Running parallel to Phuket’s famous Vegetarian Festival (Oct 13-21), Amari Phuket offers a package for those who wish to get spiritual in style. Stay for at least three nights in any room type to receive a 10 per cent discount on room rates, breakfast buffet and one-way transfer from the hotel to Jui Tui Shrine, to be a part of the festival. Use promo code “PKTVGF2015” to book this package online. 
V Amari Phuket, 2 Muen-ngern Road, Patong Beach, Phuket.C 076-340-106-14. EARLY BIRD GETS THE DISCOUNT 
The Holiday Dreamers Advance Purchase, GLOW Elixir Koh Yao Yai Resort, Through Oct 31 
Plan your getaway ahead of time to reap sweet discounts. The earlier you book, the larger the discounts, obvi. Book 14 days in advance to receive 25 per cent discount on best available rates for a stay in a Superior Villa, Deluxe Villa or Beach Front Pool Villa. These rates are further reduced by five per cent when you book 30 days in advance. Prices include breakfast for two. 
V Glow Elixir Koh Yao Yai Resort, 99 Moo 3, Prunai, Koh Yao Yai, Phang Nga.C 087-808-3838.P From B3,375 per night if booked 14 days in advance; B3,150 if booked 30 days in advance.   0 people liked / 0
